programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When an attorney is found dead near the body of a private escort, the team must piece together what connected the two seemingly random victims; Jubal's connection with one of the victims makes finding the killer much more personal.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After a truck filled with armor-piercing rifles is hijacked, the team works to discover who stole it, and what they have planned for the stolen weapons; a friend from OA's past returns to help with the case, but OA isn't sure he can trust him.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: After the police ignore a desperate father's plea for help, he abducts a billionaire's daughter and holds her hostage in a safe room until his own missing child is returned to him; Jubal puts his hostage negotiation skills to the test.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: When the team is called to the scene of a murder, it quickly suspects political motivation; Maggie contemplates a decision that could affect her entire career.

programme.title: FBI
programme.desc: Jess LaCroix and his team come to help OA find a fugitive LaCroix arrested years ago after a bus with 26 students goes missing and he's the main suspect.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: The former secretary of an old friend, Simon, visits Mike Hammer with a theory about her old boss's sudden death. Mike chalks up her death to Simon's adventurous streak, until he shows up alive in his apartment. Simon reveals how he continued to play dead after a hired assassin took shots at him and two other hunting buddies. Looking for revenge, Simon talks Mike into helping him track down his assassin, and hunt that takes the private eye all the way to California. However, Mike soon after meets danger on this journey.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: After failing to save a tobacco company scientist scheduled to testify in court, Mike Hammer decides to quit smoking. However, a clean lifestyle becomes harder than he thought when he follows up on his client's murder. The dead scientist leaves behind questions about the killer's motives, his work at the company, and the tobacco industry at large. Of course, the nicotine withdrawals don't seem to help.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike Hammer becomes increasingly involved with the tobacco company and the family that owns it after he takes a job as their poster boy. The head of the company wishes to get to know Mike better and invited him to stay at their mansion. Some of the other family members hope that Mike's new status will prevent him from asking any more questions. But the death of Loolie leads to an investigation that Hammer just can't quit.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike Hammer is on the beat after the untimely death of former policeman Chic Farrell's death. After Mike finds Chic's son dead in a heroin house, the former cop is burning for revenge. Chic's own murder leaves Mike Hammer alone to find the killers, and the only witness is a strung out hooker who's on the run. The Russians and their steady supply of heroin to the city put them high up on Hammer's list of suspects.

programme.title: Mike Hammer, Private Eye
programme.desc: Mike Hammer is hired to investigate a toxic chemical dump in the Hudson River by Patrick Dean, the man accused of the crime. Hammer is no fan of tabloids, but his sleuthing uncovers new headlines of his own. While looking to clear his name, the journalist who broke the story and incriminated Patrick is found dead. Now, Hammer starts to suspect that his client might not be as clean as he claimed to be.

programme.desc: Callen and Granger try to clear Sam's name after he's arrested for a woman's murder; Kensi and Deeks find a link between the victim and Sam's past.

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: The team suspects a terrorist group is responsible when a man is murdered by a small drone; Nell tries to avoid disaster in Long Beach.

programme.desc: Chief Boden makes a risky last minute decision to save his men; Dawson continues to deal with her father; Brett's childhood friend visits and strikes the attention of someone within the firehouse; a fire at a high school hits close to home for Boden.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Danny pursues a con artist pretending to be the legendary singer Jimmy Buffett; Frank investigates an impressive police captain who is using her badge to get free wares from local stores.

programme.desc: After a young woman in South Carolina is found dead in her bathtub, the investigation focuses in on her estranged husband and her boyfriend; an unexpected digital clue has one of these persons of interest accidentally confessing to the murder.

programme.desc: A large black creature emerging from a family's toilet could be some kind of mythical creature; an eerie radio station may secretly be part of a Russian military plan; an astronaut sees something out the window of the International Space Station.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: A human flying through the skies of Los Angeles may be a real-life Iron Man; an amorphous blob in the water could be the spawn of the fabled Kraken; aliens may have already set up a base at the North Pole.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: A petrified creature discovered in Russia is said to be the work of the mythical Baba Yaga; a possible genetic experiment gone wrong; a fire with a mind of its own.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: A baby shark develops an eerie, humanlike face; blue lights in the sky may be a sign that the end is coming; possible aliens vacation over Lake Superior.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: Investigating if a breed of dogs could possess the power to completely freeze time; asking if invisibility cloaking is possible; looking for evidence that aliens crash-landed in Antarctica several millenniums ago.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: Asking if aliens could be human time travelers from the future or if a trick shot could classify a person as superhuman; someone may have found the lost Malaysian Airlines Flight 370 hiding in the jungle.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: A sword discovered at the bottom of a river may be the famed Excalibur, wielded by King Arthur himself; a doorbell cam captures possible proof of teleportation; aliens could be visiting a family every Independence Day.

programme.title: The Proof Is Out There
programme.desc: For 54 years, the famed Patterson-Gimlin bigfoot film has been touted as the best proof the creature exists; with AI technology, a never-before-seen restoration of the film makes the figure known as "Patty" clearer than ever before.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: How do some people live through the impossible? Remarkable tales of human survival force us to reconsider what we know about our own will to live.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Could a cache of fantastic riches have been buried centuries ago on a tiny island in the North Atlantic?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Abandoned cities. Ancient cultures nearly erased by time. And colossal empires that simply vanished without a trace. How does a civilization become "lost?"

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Whether legends of vast, lost treasures hidden throughout the U.S. are real or tall tales.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Scientists are involved in a never-ending quest to understand the vast universe the planet inhabits; it seems that for each answer science provides, even more questions arise.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Throughout history, many have believed that certain places, things, or even people can be tainted with dark curses. Ominous lakes that morph into watery graves.

programme.title: Crime 360
programme.desc: On a hot summer day in Richmond, Detective Shane Waite is called to a local apartment complex where there is believed to be a dead body inside the trunk of a car.

programme.title: Crime 360
programme.desc: Detective Jaime Baynes is called to the scene of a possible homicide. After interviewing a few witnesses, Baynes learns the victim ran 100 yards, coughing up blood along the way.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: When 18-year-old Conrad Roy is found asphyxiated in his pickup truck, his death is quickly ruled a suicide; as detectives retrace Conrad's final moments, texts left on his cell phone reveal a toxic romance between him and Michelle Carter.

programme.title: American Justice
programme.desc: In February 2014, Houston police receive a tip from a conscientious bail bondsman that a murder-for-hire plot is in the works and a woman's life may be in danger.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: An heir to the Halliburton oil dynasty fortune, Jill Halliburton Su, is found dead in the bathtub by her son Justin at her upscale home in a Florida gated community in 2014.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: A camper gathering firewood in Arizona's scenic Sunset Crater National Park is shocked to discover the body of a young woman in a traditional long dress; her Mennonite family and friends are stunned.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: An exchange student finds a career and a love match in the idyllic Missouri university town of Columbia; it's a shock to her friends and family when she disappears, leaving both her child and cellphone behind.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: On a summer night, Amanda Colley returns to a ransacked house; her love interest Lamar and two girlfriends arrive to join her, and gunshots ring out; Amanda and her friend Lindy are found dead.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: In 1993, a newborn baby's body is discovered; the coroner determines the baby had been born alive; after 25 years, and with the assistance of modern DNA techniques, Gail Eastwood-Ritchey is found guilty of murder and sentenced to life in prison.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: Ten days after NBA player Lorenzen Wright goes missing, the player's body is found in a swamp, shot 11 times; police search for clues to identify who killed the basketball star.

programme.title: Killer Cases
programme.desc: When Ohio State senior Reagan Tokes fails to respond to messages from her parents, they fear the worst; their nightmare becomes a reality when a caller reports the discovery of a female body in the local park; detectives race to solve the crime.

programme.desc: The story of driver Davey Allisons tumultuous attempt to win the 1992 NASCAR title.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: A cut down of the classic 1993 Daytona 500 featuring fun facts and trivia about the race and pop culture in 1993.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: An unpredictable experiment to install lights at Charlotte Motor Speedway results in a game-changing moment for motorsports and one of the most dramatic finishes in NASCAR history.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: Documentary that captures the story of the Clash at the Coliseum through the eyes of drivers and fans.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: A documentary film taking a fun look at the past, present and future of NASCAR video games.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: New interviews and archive footage illustrate the unique stories and dominant drivers from NASCAR's oldest track.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: Decades before Danica Patrick became a household name and the face of women in motorsports, Janet Guthrie broke down the Sports gender barrier.

programme.title: NASCAR on FOX Films
programme.desc: This Racing Life explores how racing binds communities together and what drives the quest of young racers to make it into NASCAR.

programme.title: Dirt Every Day
programme.desc: The guys are on the hunt for Colorado's finest four-wheelin' trails.

programme.title: Dirt Every Day
programme.desc: Fred and Dave get their hands on the new Bronco.

programme.title: Dirt Every Day
programme.desc: The guys build a YJ for Dave, then take it out for some wheelin.'

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian starts work on an all-aluminum Defender that has a Jeep JK chassis.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian installs more of the Defender's drivetrain, plus wheels and tires.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian creates his own short bed Jeep Gladiator by transforming a Jeep JK.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian modifies a 1998 Chevy T6500 for towing, overlanding and motorhoming.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian makes tons of custom parts to finish the All-Aluminum Defender project.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian gets a cheap Mercedes 300D ready for a local Gambler 500 rally.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since the Bronco is back, Ian pays homage to the very cool box-style Bronco of the past. He helps with the handling by adding an upgraded suspension, and adds new bumpers for a more aggressive look. Plus, he fixes some gremlins in the inline-six mot.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: How a factory two-door Toyota Tacoma can be made into the perfect off-road truck with the right axles and suspension.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian continues the Tacoma project, but this time he completely reshapes the truck with a fiberglass body kit and truck cap, then cuts out the rear window to give it a vintage 4Runner look.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian takes the All-Aluminum Defender on the Kentucky Adventure Trail.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian turns a stack of tubes into a shorter trail chassis and adds new axles.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The mock-up on the trail chassis continues as Ian adds a motor and transmission to the build; it's time to get axles underneath with a new third member so he can go four-wheel drive all the time.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Ian brings in a 1968 M715 to make it more reliable; he takes the body off the original chassis and stretches a Jeep JK chassis to make it fit; he adds upgraded suspension, 1-ton axles and an LS engine to make it a truck that can fight any battle.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since a TJ can be had for under 10K, Ian shows how to buy a Jeep on a budget and outfit it with everything needed to hit the rocks and still have money left over.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: The Budget TJ gets some more parts; Ian updates the suspension with new coilovers; he adds new bumpers front and rear, and by the end of the day, this TJ is trail ready.

programme.title: FourWheeler
programme.desc: Since a TJ can be had for under 10K, Ian shows how to buy a Jeep on a budget and outfit it with everything needed to hit the rocks and still have money left over.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys try their hand at no-prep drag racing against Lyle Barnett and his turbocharged 1,500-hp Beer Money Mustang.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: For years, Pigpen, the junkyard rescued 1950 GMC truck, has sat dormant; the guys awaken a monster by donating the chassis of their own legendary 1985 S-15 in a body swap for the ages, then take on Randy Pobst at Atlanta Motor Speedway.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys convert their '72 Honda "Bozo" into a micro dirt-track ripper.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys uncover a cop car racing series around the Ford Crown Victoria P71 Police Interceptor; with a handful of bolt-on upgrades, they turn their former police auction find into a road race ripper around Willow Springs.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys take on off-road Baja legend Cameron Steele on a brutal desert off-road course with a Baja Bug; they may be outmatched by Cameron's unlimited racing rig, but the addition of a 350 V-8 to their Bug closes a big gap.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys give their Fiero-based kit car Scamborghini a 6-foot lift.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: Dave's '57 Bel Air gets a suspension overhaul in an event's parking lot.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys go all-out with suspension upgrades to the Baja-inspired Beetle.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys turn a stock Model A into a true hot rod and dragstrip contender.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: Newbern and Cotten discover a gem in a turbocharged Eagle Talon.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: Newbern surprises Cotten with a 1984 G-body and a stock-car-inspired build.

programme.title: Faster With Newbern and Cotten
programme.desc: The guys try to revive Cotten's Pro Street big-block 1980 Dodge Mirada.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The guys rebuild a 1985 S15 truck to race against a Shelby GT350.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Drag racing a blown 383 small block Chevy powered '74 Jaguar XJ 12 Draguar against a 302 Windsor V8.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The Vette Kart has proven itself worthy on autocross, big track, dragstrip, sand dune and stunt courses; testing the Kart's rallying capabilities against champion drifters.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The guys and their big red K5 Blazer take on a local racer at the West Georgia Mud Park; after finding numerous issues with the Blazer, they decide the best way to add more power for cheap is a good ol' LS swap.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The guys see if the Nascarlo or the Death Metal Charger is faster around a dirt oval.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: TV personality John Andrade Jr. ("Street Outlaws") joins the guys in a messy battle, when a 1975 dirt-track Camaro goes head-to-head with a big-block-powered Toyota mud truck on a makeshift drag strip down the center of a mud park.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: One crushed project means new parts for another; the guys take on a NASCAR stock car piloted by Corey LaJoie around Atlanta Motor Speedway by recycling the supercharger from their wrecked T-Bird and slapping it on a 1978 Ford Fairmont.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The guys transform a Miata into the ultimate nitrous toy, the Man-iata; Newbern challenges Finnegan and Cotten to see if they can keep up with his Honda Talon UTV.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Newbern surprises Cotten and Finnegan with a visit to the sacred grounds of Dennis Anderson's Digger's Dungeon; the guys rebuild a busted-up mega truck and take on Finnegan's childhood idol in a race against the creator of Grave Digger himself.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The guys put John Andrade Jr. in a tiny truck and beat him in a mud drag race with the Dirt Track Camaro; Andrade challenges them to see what they can do with a derelict and parted-out Mustang against his 79 Chevy Malibu.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Cotten challenges Finnegan and Newbern to some front-wheel-drive, high-school-antics-style racing; the guys hop up three cheap import beaters, build metal skids to replace the rear wheels, and have the wildest race to date.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The LS-powered S-15 mini truck gets a revamp when the guys fix what didn't work from the last time they raced Randy Pobst around a road course in a Shelby GT350.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The guys transform a '73 Opel funny car into a dirt-roosting machine.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The dream of long travel suspension on Roadkill's slightly modified Vette Kart finally comes true for the guys; Brad DeBerti helps them figure out how to not taco the front end as they take on a Pro2 truck on an off-road short course.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Newbern, Cotten, and Finnegan participate in an unusual race that requires their boat to survive the competitors' attacks on a dirt track.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Newbern and Cotten surprise Finnegan with a 2.3L 1980 Pinto wagon and drift lessons from pro Formula Drift driver Federico Sceriffo; they add a 396ci stroker engine and suspension mods before taking on a 1,000-plus-hp Ferrari 599 GTB.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Finnegan, Newbern and Cotten do some wheelie R&D to find out what it takes to put a 1978 GMC Class C motorhome's tires in the air; with the help of pro wheelstander Mike Mantel, the guys take on the challenge of making dreams become reality.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The 1978 GMC motorhome takes on Mike Mantel's Little Red Firetruck.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Cotten, Newbern and Finnegan make a low-buck version of an OBS Yukon by lowering it, upgrading the suspension and fixing some performance issues.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Cotton, Newbern, and Finnegan learn how a simple suspension upgrade can become a house of cards; major snags are hit and overcome as they attempt to run an 8-second pass with their supercharged barn-find '67 Firebird known as the Rubber Duck.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: The hill-climbing, ice-racing, nitrous-infused Man-iata is back! Cotten and Newbern take on Finnegan himself to see if they can beat him up the infamous Third Hill at Indian Mountain in the awesome sand drag truck known as the Drag-Kota.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: It's not the size of the car that matters, it's how it's driven; Cotten and Newbern drastically improve the power-to-weight ratio of a teeny '72 Honda Z600 coupe in an attempt to set a record at MidPond Raceway.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: David and Mike cut some serious lap time off a '68 Ford Torino GT as they take on a high-dollar Pro-Touring beast of a Chevy C10; in just two days the guys totally transform their poor-touring Torino.

programme.title: Faster With Finnegan
programme.desc: Mike and David revitalize their '78 Ford Flairmont; they're stepping into the ring and adding blown LS power to shred even more tires with Bill Goldberg and a Hellcat Redeye at Talladega.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew tests the effects of running long vs. short rods on otherwise identical engines; they'll find out if long rods make more torque, if shorter rods' faster swipe makes a difference, or if rod length doesn't actually matter.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys find out which cheap carburetors produce the most expensive results; they pick a fight among remanufactured offerings from Edelbrock, Summit and Demon to see which will pump the most power into their 383 Chevrolet.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys flip things upside down to find out how much power might be left in the oil pan; a number of factors play a part in minimizing turbulence around the crank, but an $1,100 solution may not be worth the cost.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys try to shed light on whether iron or aluminum heads will deliver more power; they'll look at weight savings and heat retention's effect on cylinder pressure.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: A camshaft is causing issues, so the crew explores how changes to cam timing can help tune a power curve for high-end performance or low-end power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys experiment with lash adjustments in an effort unleash more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys test whether a dual or a single exhaust system has more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys answer the question of whether a carb spacer produces more power.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys do a 4/7 swap on a big 572 to see if there's more power to be had.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys compare four of the most popular intake manifolds on the market.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys take 555 BBC and the Blower Shop then test the difference in power between gas and e85.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys dive into the lobe separation angle of the camshaft.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys explore the gains to be found for a sickly, low-compression 440.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys go through the basics of bringing a motor to the dyno cell.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew asks whether it's worth it to upgrade an ignition system.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys explore how header collector length affects power output.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The guys follow Freiburger's personal quest for 1,000 NA horsepower.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew investigates just how much power gets sacrificed to look cool.

programme.title: Dolly's Game
programme.desc: Old school legends PokerGO's newest show. Relive the 2-7 NL Single Draw action and the Dolly's Game debut with Doyle Brunson John Monnette Billy Baxter Shawn Sheikhan and Majid Yahyaei now.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $5,000 Seven Card Stud World Championship attracted 144 entrants and created a prize pool of $676,800. The WSOP bracelet and $221,000 first-place prize would look to be claimed by a savvy group of final tablists that included Marcel Luske, Jeff Lisandro, Joe Awada, Cory Zeidman, Dewey Tomko and John Juanda.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Phil Hellmuth headlines the $3,000 Pot-Limit Hold'em final table that includes Ram Vaswani and Phi Nguyen, while Gavin Griffin chases the title of youngest WSOP bracelet of all-time if he can emerge victorious. Who will win the $270,420 first-place prize and prestigious WSOP bracelet?

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The only straight Razz tournament of the 2004 WSOP would see a field of 195 players. Chris Bjorin, Hoyt Corkins, John Juanda, Howard Lederer, and Dutch Boyd all look to deny T.J. Cloutier his fifth WSOP bracelet as all eyes are on the $90,500 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #5: $10,000 8-Game final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Cary Katz is the chip leader ahead of Nick Guagenti, Alex Livingston, Steve Zolotow, Benjamin Diebold, Jacky Wang, and Brian Rast, as the final seven players play for the $186,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Glistening in the Snow
programme.desc: When struggling club owner Anaja finds out that her co-owner, Donovan, is coming to town for the holiday, she expects him to help keep the doors open. However, his fianc Addie wants him to sell the club. When the owners and staff are trapped in the club during a snow storm, they will have to work together to resolve their issues with each other.

programme.title: Mother of a Christmas
programme.desc: Ben and his family plan a family vacation to the beach, including his mother-in-law. When his wife and children experience delays at the airport, he has an unforgettable experience being trapped in a house wit his mother-in-law.

programme.title: A Very Merry New Year
programme.desc: A Fortune 500 CEO decides to gather her best high school friends for a New Year's Eve reunion celebration that winds up exposing long-hidden secrets.

programme.title: The Green Grass
programme.desc: When a mans money, success and power attracts attention, he must dig deep within himself to stop his life from spinning wildly out of control.

programme.title: The Foreign Exchange Student 2:The Hunt
programme.desc: Mr. and Mrs. Nelson are excited to be getting two new foreign exchange students to live with them. Then, a chain of murders starts to happen again in the city of Houston. They suspect the murders may be connected to Sinclair's death.

programme.title: The Exit Row
programme.desc: Sasha Dade is dedicated to her demanding, yet comfortable, life as a wife, mother and advertising executive near the nation's capital. Clint Meyers is a top-selling real estate agent and investor who projects sensitivity, but harbors a dark side. Their worlds collide when a chance encounter on a traumatic flight leads to a deadly obsession.

programme.title: Ebony Hustle 2: Ballistic Protection
programme.desc: A female private investigator looks to correct a mistake from the past.

programme.title: The Perfect Mother
programme.desc: Linda, a determined mother, faces the daily struggles of raising her son amidst the unpredictable presence of her husband. When a series of hardships push her to the edge, Linda's plea for assistance leads to Ahmad being taken into CPS custody.

programme.title: Missing you this Christmas
programme.desc: Carmen's family has an annual Christmas tradition that supports her neighborhood. When her mother dies suddenly, she looses the holiday spirit, and no longer wants to continue, until she's visited by her late father's spirit who encourages her to keep hope alive.

programme.title: A Holiday for Harmony
programme.desc: Jaxon Moore is a struggling arcade bar owner with debt and facing a possible shutdown before the holiday season. When his sister dies in a car crash, he becomes the guardian of his young niece Harmony, who inherited a trust fund from her late mother.

programme.title: Rain for Christmas
programme.desc: A decision is made by Malik to bring his girlfriend home to Houston for Christmas. When she is met by his family, it is thought by them that he is all wrong for her. The grandpa's nurse, Rain, is met by Malik, and the true meaning of love and what is really wanted for Christmas are soon realized by him.

programme.title: Naughty or Nice
programme.desc: Melody, an exotic dancer, and her doctor boyfriend, Patrick, prepare to spend the holidays with Patrick's family. When they arrive, they are met by Patrick's overprotective judgmental mother, and she unleashes her wrath on Melody, as she's not good enough for her son.

programme.title: Christmas With da Fam
programme.desc: After Malcom proposes to Serenity, she takes him home to meet her family for the holidays. The spirit is alive, until they discover that Serenity's ex Denzel is living with her family after a house fire. A rivalry develops between Malcolm and Denzel that ends up in a hilarious battle of wits over the holiday weekend.

programme.title: Mixed Christmas
programme.desc: Aurora wants to enjoy the holidays this year in some warmth and sunshine, and invites her three best friends to Miami for a Christmas trip to remember. When they arrive at their AirBnb, they discover it's been double booked by Aurora's ex-girlfriend and her new partner Axel. They have no choice but to combine their plans, and celebrate the holiday together.

programme.title: What a Day Before Christmas
programme.desc: Nathan and Naomi are at odds about the direction of their marriage, and reluctance to get in the Christmas Spirit is shown by Nathan. As an ultimatum, it is insisted by Naomi that the holidays are spent by Nathan with her and her family, but it is Christmas Eve. The help of Nathan's cousin Keith is enlisted, and a road trip is embarked upon by the two as they race against time. An attempt is made to get home for the holidays and save the marriage.

programme.title: Glistening in the Snow
programme.desc: When struggling club owner Anaja finds out that her co-owner, Donovan, is coming to town for the holiday, she expects him to help keep the doors open. However, his fianc Addie wants him to sell the club. When the owners and staff are trapped in the club during a snow storm, they will have to work together to resolve their issues with each other.

programme.title: CLUTCH
programme.desc: Detectives Clutch and Angel navigate a criminal underworld with the help of three women, whom Clutch is familiar with, to solve the disappearance of a group of women.

programme.title: Conflict of Interest
programme.desc: When Mickey (Christopher McDonald) returns to the police force after a long hiatus, he has his sights set on shady businessman Gideon (Judd Nelson). Everyone knows that Gideon peddles drugs and sex and sells stolen cars. When Mickey's son, Jason (Gregory Alan Harris), is framed for murder, Mickey is set to prove that Gideon is behind it all. In his search for justice and revenge, Mickey is willing to do anything, and he's determined to shut Gideon down forever.

programme.title: Caught in a Trapp
programme.desc: Drama following the journey of a teen boy who is forced into a dangerous life on the streets after the death of his parents.

programme.title: Curves Under the Mistletoe
programme.desc: After losing her mother on Christmas Day and suffering through a difficult childhood, Delight perseveres to find love and her place in the world.

programme.title: Everybody Hates Christmas
programme.desc: When a family loses faith in Christmas, an angel reminds them that the spirit of the holiday is about more than just giving and receiving gifts.

programme.title: Black Santa
programme.desc: A Christmastime tragedy turns the lives of two boys from a loving family in the Houston suburbs upside down and sends them into a foster home.

programme.title: Mother of a Christmas
programme.desc: Ben and his family plan a family vacation to the beach, including his mother-in-law. When his wife and children experience delays at the airport, he has an unforgettable experience being trapped in a house wit his mother-in-law.

programme.title: Missing you this Christmas
programme.desc: Carmen's family has an annual Christmas tradition that supports her neighborhood. When her mother dies suddenly, she looses the holiday spirit, and no longer wants to continue, until she's visited by her late father's spirit who encourages her to keep hope alive.

programme.title: A Holiday for Harmony
programme.desc: Jaxon Moore is a struggling arcade bar owner with debt and facing a possible shutdown before the holiday season. When his sister dies in a car crash, he becomes the guardian of his young niece Harmony, who inherited a trust fund from her late mother.

programme.title: Rain for Christmas
programme.desc: A decision is made by Malik to bring his girlfriend home to Houston for Christmas. When she is met by his family, it is thought by them that he is all wrong for her. The grandpa's nurse, Rain, is met by Malik, and the true meaning of love and what is really wanted for Christmas are soon realized by him.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris's job is in jeopardy after joining a protest she strongly believes in, leading to tense discussions within the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben's mom arrives after an unexpected death and unveils shocking information from the past; Becky and Emilio spend more time together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris brings home her new friend, Josh, leaving the family questioning his intentions; Becky and Ben's attempt to build a closet stirs up family drama.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene earns a promotion at Wellman Plastics, while Ben decides on a new career path; Jackie tries an herbal tea. and it leads to an emotional revelation.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Chuck's new purchase of a boat creates a rift; Darlene hires her first assistant at Wellman's Plastics but soon realizes she is anything but helpful.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene starts to feel the pressures of her new job; Dan attempts to help Ben out at the hardware store, but the two don't always agree on how to run the business.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is convinced he has COVID-19; Becky and Harris team up to confront Josh, who has been 'ghosting' Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan feels helpless when Louise refuses to let him put himself at risk for her; when Jackie learns the competing restaurants are posting negative reviews.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky meets up with an old friend and feels pressured to impress him; Dan questions his position at the hardware store, leading to a massive fight between him and Ben.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky is working double shifts and taking classes at the community college, resulting in less time with her daughter; Dan decides to foster an elderly dog.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene learns shocking news about a friend; the Conners family comes together to help someone close to them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan encounters a surprise visitor who shares some unsolicited advice, leaving him feeling guilty; Darlene welcomes a new employee to Wellman Plastics.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark is stressed and exhausted from studying for an important entrance exam, so Darlene steps in to help, but her plan backfires.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene makes a decision about her trip to Hawaii, leading to a heated encounter with Barb; Becky gives a presentation on addiction to Mark's class.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Two proposals bring big changes to the Conner family; Jackie uses her Jeopardy infamy to her advantage.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners continue to deal with the pandemic while navigating breakups and newfound sobriety, all while planning an upcoming wedding.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Ben declines Darlene's proposal, she starts to ponder why she tends to be so negative in life, prompting her to start a journey of self-discovery, which leads to Pastor Phil.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Part of Becky's recovery program mandates she make amends with people she has lied to over the years, leading her to meet up again with a former high school friend.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Dan and Louise's wedding day, but it's a far-from-perfect, especially when a weather report forecasts that a tornado is headed for Lanford creating chaos and surprises.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are ready for Halloween, despite a leaky roof that forces Dan and Louise to cancel their honeymoon

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene worries about Mark making friends at his new school; Mark turns to Ben for advice; Becky finds herself thriving in college and starts thinking about her future plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie devises an offbeat plan to serve the customers at The Lunch Box, it's anything but smooth; Dan begins to sell furniture to make room for his new bride and her things.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Louise starts to move in, Dan decides to sell the furniture he bought for Roseanne when they were married; he soon finds parting with the furniture harder than he thought.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene brings Nick to the hardware store, where they run into Ben, who invites Nick to join him at The Lunch Box to watch a Bears game.

programme.desc: The Conners celebrate Mark when he makes Dean's List at his new magnet school; Jackie continues to navigate her relationship with Neville.

programme.desc: Darlene continues to navigate her breakup with Ben; Dan offers to talk with Aldo's dad when he doesn't approve of Harris and Aldo's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark returns to public school and finds it hard to fit in; Darlene isn't happy when she finds out what Mark's doing to make extra cash for college.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The family is locked down in their home due to a shooting incident in the neighborhood.

programme.desc: When Becky outs her relationship with Professor Davis, it's his erratic behavior that sends Becky down a path to reevaluate their relationship.

programme.desc: Dan enlists a few friends to help him with the funeral home remodel; Robin and Darlene take a big career risk.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Ben and Darlene are excited to share their good news with the family, but Neville and Jackie, and Aldo and Harris, share their own very similar news.

programme.desc: The Conners gear up for a megawedding; Jackie & Neville, Darlene & Ben, Harris & Aldo are planning for a big day, but discover that some of the couples may not be on the same page.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.desc: Mark is anxious to get his driver's license; Darlene attempts to teach Mark to drive, but her frantic energy sends him running to Ben for help; Harris meets a new guy online.

programme.desc: When a relative passes away unexpectedly, the family must debate about who should gain custody of a jaded nephew, who is just shy of his 18th birthday.

programme.desc: Problems arise on Beverly Rose's first day of kindergarten; Becky and Darlene have a disagreement.

programme.desc: Harris takes a stand on an issue that ruffles a few feathers in Darlene's new neighborhood.

programme.desc: Jackie must come to terms with her mother becoming ill; Darlene's job hunt proves to be more difficult than anticipated.

programme.desc: The death of a beloved teacher from Dan and Jackie's high school brings old classmates together.

programme.desc: Harris makes a big announcement; Ben is overwhelmed with family responsibilities.

programme.desc: Louise gets into a feud with Becky after accidentally sending a rude message in the family text thread.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Steve and Allard welcome their rivals to 1692 Wasdale in the Lake District. Fiona and Shauna think it's picture perfect, but other guests face tricky technology and cleanliness concerns.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Blackpool and confident John welcomes his rivals to the Lynbar Hotel. He says his breakfast is the best in Blackpool and hopes his guests will agree.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Pencader, Wales and the School House bed and breakfast, owned by eco-friendly couple Jayne and Ian, where they hope their environmental approach will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Cathedral 73 in Cardiff, managed by Neil Chidzey and Assistant Manager Jo Goodwin. Guests are wowed by the glamorous rooms, but the costs prove hard to swallow.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to Leafy Suburban bed and breakfast in Northwood, where golfer Raj Kumar opens the doors to his home. However, Neil and Jo are not impressed with a surprise visitor.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Wellington Inn in Hertfordshire where resources manager Felicity Rainbow takes a spiritual approach to hosting - but the `Welly' twist is not a hit with everyone.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Strontian Boutique in Strontian, Scotland, where Callum Pegg and his partner head chef Darren Anderson want to treat their guests to an exclusive stay.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to The Helix Hotel in Grangemouth, Stirlingshire, where host Nawaz Haq wants to show off his hotel, catering to the travelling businessman. Come morning, the group raises concerns over the breakfast banquet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Black Boy Hotel in Sudbury, where hosts Kate Martin and sister Marie Carlton want their guests to kick back and embrace the historical surroundings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is to The Lodge Bed and Breakfast in Cannock, Staffordshire, where hosts Lee and Marie Garnett are hoping their guests take to their homely BandB, but have they done enough to win?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Ship Inn in Dymchurch, Kent run by 21-year-old partners James Tindall and Jessica Walton, who believe age is but a number. Over breakfast, a frank airing of views sets the standard for the week.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Thompson Hall Retreat in Norfolk, run by mother and daughter duo Amanda and Becci. On arrival, everyone is wowed by the stylish shepherd huts with outside bath.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions are simmering as the guests head to The White House in Brighton.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Jacobs Plough in Bicester, Oxfordshire, run by manager Duncan Froomes and bar supervisor Ryan Hunt who like to mix banter with business. The criticism continues, with feedback that leaves the hosts praying for a miracle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Edenmore Guest House in Ardrossan, owner Hugh Begbie dreads the prospect of guests who are too `kissy-kissy, touchy-touchy'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Tug of Words
programme.desc: Based on the playground game Tug-O-War, teams of two compete to answer word-clue questions correctly and pull the flag on the tug of war rope to their side.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. Each team's goal is to guess the results of audience survey questions. A player from each team initially faces off, answering the question to earn the chance to either pass or play. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Mini Patel, Michael O'Hare and Tim Allen are going head to head this week for a chance to represent the North East region in the National Finals. Today it's a battle for starter course, and the first chance to impress their formidable veteran chef.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fight for the fish course, as three of the North East's finest chefs - Mini Patel, Michael O'Hare and Tim Allen - are out to impress. After his risky starter caused a stir yesterday Michael is planning another controversial dish in honour of the WI's support of women's rights.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the North East's most dynamic chefs - Mini Patel, Michael O'Hare and Tim Allen - go head to head cooking their main courses. Michelin-starred Tim is super keen to bag the first ten of the week, but Michael and Mini are hot on his heels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the North East chefs' last chance to impress with the dessert course. It's been a week of highs and lows, modern audacious dishes and classic masterpieces but with only two places up for grabs cooking for the judges, at the end of today who will leave the competition empty handed?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook all four courses again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by a guest judge - WI president Kirsty Bowen from Sheffield - who will help decide which chef will go through to represent the North East in the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Representing the North West are Eve Townson, Matt Worswick and returning contender Mark Ellis. Today's the starter course, and after failing to cook for the judges last year Mark's out to redeem himself but he faces stiff competition in executive chef Eve and young gun Matt.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course, as three of the North West's finest chefs - Eve Townson, Matt Worswick and Mark Ellis - go head to head. Eve and Matt are hoping their classic approach to cooking fish will win the day whilst Mark is going all out with fishy take on a traditional dessert recipe.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle for the main course for the three North West chefs - Eve Townson, Matt Worswick and Mark Ellis. Mark remains determined and focused on his battle to get to judges chamber this year, but as the pressure to plate up perfection reaches fever pitch, will all three chefs get a dish to the pass?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the North West chefs' last chance to impress, with the dessert course. Only two can cook for the judges tomorrow. It's the end of the road for one chef, but who will it be?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North West chefs cook their entire menus again for the judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by award winning food writer Sabrina Ghayour and together they'll decide which chef will go on to represent the North West in the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the starter course for three of London and the South East's hottest chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Marcus Wareing's protg Mark Froydenlund. Returning contender Matt Gillan is determined to make it to this year's banquet, but he faces fierce competition in the two newcomers.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The London and South East chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Marcus Wareing's protg Mark Froydenlund - go head to head with their fish courses. Lee is hoping his modern plate of mackerel and passion fruit will outclass Matt and Mark's more traditionally inspired salmon dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course for three of London and the South East's finest chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Mark Froydenlund. Returning contender Matt is determined to bring home a 10 with his ambitious celebration of the billy goat but has he bitten off more than he can chew?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and the London and South East chefs are striving to secure one of the two spots in tomorrow's Regional Final. The scores are close, so it's all to play for, as today marks the end of the competition for one man.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and South East chefs are cooking all four courses again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by Mary Gwynn, author of the official WI centenary cookbook. Together they'll decide which chef goes through to represent the region in the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the Central Region's finest chefs - Pip Lacey, Richard Bainbridge and Jason Hodnett - attempt to impress this week's veteran judge with their starters. With big boots to fill, Angela Hartnett's protg Pip is the only newcomer in the kitchen. Will she beat the boys to claim victory?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three Central Region chefs - newcomer Pip Lacey, 4th time competitor Richard Bainbridge and returning chef Jason Hodnett - fight it out in the fish course. Pip is hoping to outclass her rivals with a smoked haddock dish inspired by her Grandma.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course with three Central Region chefs - Pip Lacey, Richard Bainbridge and Jason Hodnett. Once again Jason is taking risks with his unusual collection of ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the Central Region chefs to impress, with the dessert course. Only two chefs can go through to cook for the judges so with everything to play for, who will plate up perfection and who will be sent packing?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Central Region chefs cook their entire menus again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They'll be joined by former chair of the Women's Institute Helen Carey, who will help decide who will have the glory of representing the region in the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the starter course, and eight of the finest chefs in the country are battling it out to plate up impeccable dishes worthy of the Women's Institute. The judges are joined by WI Calendar Girl Angela Baker, but after Oliver reveals that this year it will be much tougher to make it onto the judge's shortlist, who will keep their cool and secure a place?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle for the fish course, and those chefs who didn't make it onto the shortlist with their starters are hoping to do better. The judges are joined by a WI president, Kristy Bowen, who knows the impeccable standards the Institute will expect.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's main course day, the half-way point in Finals Week, and those chefs who have yet to get a dish on the shortlist are feeling the heat. With only dishes judged to be perfect in with a chance at reaching the WI banquet, the standards are higher than ever before.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for dessert, and the last chance for the eight regional champions to get a dish in contention for the final banquet. Those who've failed to make the judges shortlist so far are going all out. Joining the judges is author of the WI centenary cookbook Mary Gwynn.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The banquet is finally here. It's the culmination of months of hard work as the winning chefs strive to plate up perfect dishes for the ladies of the Women's Institute, at London's historic Draper's Hall where pioneers of the WI once gathered.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the turn of the Scottish chefs, Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison, in the battle of the starters. So which dish is going to fly the flag for Scotland? Will it be cock-a-leekie terrine, pigeon salad or Scotch pie?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The Scottish chefs are all fighting for supremacy in the fish course. So who is going to come out on top? Will it be lobster cocktail cooked four ways, lobster with vegetables, or mussels and langoustine with sorrel soup and tattie scones?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle of the main courses, as the Scottish chefs go all out to win, with their takes on hogget Scotch pie with peas and carrots, steak and chips with a tomato relish and lamb with haggis, pearl barley and turnip puree.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the Scottish chefs Michael Smith, Tony Singh and Alan Murchison to show they've got what it takes to win. So which dessert will deliver the sweet smell of success - strawberry shortbread with whisky cream, carrot cake with cream cheese ice-cream or rhubarb and custard with ginger biscuits? And which chef will be going home early?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is judgement day and the two chefs must cook their entire menus for the Great British Menu judges, Prue Leith, Matthew Fort and Oliver Peyton.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: rabbit with pea mousse, ham hock with pea puree and heather smoked macon with pickled beetroot.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from the South West - Henry Herbert, John Hooker and Nathan Outlaw - are all out to impress with their fish dishes: cider-cured sea trout, poached lobster with courgette flowers and trout, crayfish and pike mousse.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the South West to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be: sea buckthorn curd meringue, gooseberry Queen of Puddings or lemon meringue with honey ice-cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only two chefs can make it through to cook for the Great British Menu judges at the end of the week and one will be going home. That decision lies with former champion Marcus Wareing, who will scrutinise their dishes every day. Today it's the starters, so which dish will he think worthy of the banquet? Will it be poached & roasted chicken with new season onions, wild rabbit and leek turnover with piccalilli, or rabbit pudding with parched peas and gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the fish course, which dish is going to be king: turbot with brown shrimps and spring vegetables, wild sea bass with shrimp toastie, or bream with hazelnuts and salted caramel?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course. Will the winning dish be Gloucester Old Spot pork with smoked venison, salt marsh lamb with sweetbreads, or oak roast middle white pork with broad beans?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing chooses his favourite from the three dishes: caramel parfait with honey ice-cream, rhubarb and custard tart with beetroot ice-cream, and strawberries with meringue and mint water ice. For one of the chefs, this is the end of the road.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The heat is on, as only one chef can make it through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is it going to be?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the chefs want the honour of cooking for the Prince and today they begin their menus with the starters: a summer salad of pea mousse with pickled beetroot, ham hock with smoked cheddar mousse and chicken terrine with asparagus, onion and jasmine.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: poached lobster with confit potatoes, sea bass with brown crab, and sea trout with apple, beetroot and smoked mussels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams pull out all the stops with their main courses: Welsh black beef with leek and potato terrine, loin and shoulder of hogget with morels, and lamb four ways with salt-baked celeriac.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chefs from Wales - Richard Davies, James Sommerin and Aled Williams - pull out all the stops with their desserts: lemon verbena baked custard, mint mousse with hazelnut biscuit and beetroot parfait with chocolate and raspberry brownie.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: This is where it gets tough, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at this year's banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out victorious?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland launch their culinary assault with the starters: braised hog's head with apple sorbet, white onion soup with roasted muntjac, and rabbit and smoked bacon salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland are all out to impress with their fish dishes: crab in barley soup with smoked oyster, hay baked rainbow trout and beetroot cured sea trout.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland square off in the battle of the main courses. So which dish will get top marks: pigeon and rabbit with carrot terrine, lamb with purple sprouting broccoli or lamb with asparagus crown?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the central region to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be, heather honey custard with rhubarb, queen of puddings or lavender junket with mead jelly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The gloves are off, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet. Who is going to come out fighting?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the most exciting talents from London and the South East region are competing for a place in the national finals. Head chef Mark Froydenlund runs Marcus Wareing's two star restaurant. Russell Bateman is head Chef at The Grove in Hertfordshire and Ronnie Murray who heads up the Hix Restaurant group.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the fish course and chef Russell Bateman is celebrating the diversity of his beloved home town of London - by combining lobster with jerk spices for an ambitious fish course with seven key elements. Ronnie Murray's taking a risk with an ingredient which is close to the veteran judge's heart and is planning to serve it at three different temperatures, warm, deep fried and frozen. And two Michelin-starred Mark Froydenlund is planning a novel way to present his dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the all-important main course and returning contender Mark Froydenlund is banking on it being his strongest dish. Russell Bateman is creating a beef dish, and Ronnie Murray's mixing a crown of lamb with a curried filling.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the dessert course and the final chance for three of London and South East's most competitive and talented chefs to get through to the judging chamber, today the veteran judge will send one chef home.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the head to head and the two highest scoring chefs from the London and South East region are cooking for judges Oliver Peyton, Prue Leith and Matthew Fort. Joining this week as guest judge is Kevin Gould, an award-winning food writer.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be a wild rabbit with ham hock, carrots, asparagus and morels; wild rabbit with a baby leaf salad, black pudding, crispy quail's egg, broad beans and a shot of real ale; or warm pork and apple pie with chilled tomato soup, Yorkshire cheeses and homemade pickle?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: line-caught North Sea mackerel with gooseberries; pickled shellfish and wood smoked crispy prawns with the `smell of the sea'; and smoked trout soup with beetroot, cucumber and oyster nuggets.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Kenny Atkinson, Tim Bilton and Lee Bennett are determined to win but which dish will take first place? Will it be roe deer with beetroot, cauliflower and sage; venison three ways with English garden vegetables; or braised feather blade of beef and Yorkshire pudding with beer and onion gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Which dessert will earn top marks? Strawberry jelly crumble with elderflower custard; a `Best of British' dessert plate - bread and butter pudding, rhubarb and custard, curd tart and strawberries and cream; or brandy snap with cider brandy cream, basil sorbet and summer fruits?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent the North East and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: All the Northern Irish chefs want the honour of cooking for HRH Prince of Wales. They kick things off with their starters, but which one is going to be first off the blocks? Will it be quail with asparagus, pork terrine with liver mousse, or slow-cooked pork belly with peas, morels and wild garlic? Former champion Richard Corrigan will decide.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: black sole fillet with crab; seared hand dived scallops and shellfish with seaweed butter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs from Northern Ireland battle it out with their main courses. Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna are determined to win, but which dish will take pole position? Will it be loin of lamb, rack of lamb with slow-cooked shoulder or fillet of Shorthorn beef with bone marrow?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Derek Creagh, Brian McCann and Niall McKenna deliver their desserts but which dish will earn top marks; strawberry and elderflower jelly with doughnuts and duck egg ice cream, poached rhubarb with lavender ice cream or brandy strawberry parfait with basil ice cream?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent Northern Ireland and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales, but who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is the national finals of `Great British Menu'. Before cooking starts the eight champions are called to London's Southbank to get a sight of the prize, the chance to cook at a banquet held at the Palace of Westminster, in celebration of everyday Great Britons honoured by the Queen. It has a huge impact on every one of the chefs, each is determined to do all he can to get a dish to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's day two of the national finals, and the eight champions cook their fish courses. This year's challenge has been to produce dishes that are a lasting legacy to the New Elizabethan Age. They must showcase the transformation in British cuisine during the Queen's historic 64 year reign.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It is main course day, the one course every chef wants to cook at the banquet. Judging the chefs' dishes are Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton and guest judge John Williams MBE, executive chef of The Ritz.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the final day of the competition, and the last chance for the eight champions to get one of their dishes to the banquet for Queen Elizabeth ll's Great Britons. Judges Matthew Fort, Prue Leith and Oliver Peyton will judge the dessert course and then decide on the banquet menu to be served at the Houses of Parliament. Joining them in the judging chamber is Grace Dent, restaurant critic, journalist and author.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure on the chefs to deliver is immense, and even the Great British Menu judges roll up their sleeves to ensure that the banquet goes according to plan.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don continues his grand garden tour of Italy. This time he is in Naples to visit some of the most sublime, romantic retreats in southern Italy. After all the formality of the green gardens around Rome and Florence, Monty seeks out idyllic horticultural gems set against the dramatic scenery of the Amalfi Coast to discover why, in the south, gardens are informal and, above all, filled with flowers.

programme.title: Monty Don's Italian Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his garden tour of Italy in the wealthy north where, in the Veneto and Lucca, extravagant pleasure gardens were created for flirtation and fun. In the Lakes, Monty meets up with the garden society, the Grandi Giardini Italiani, to peer over the fence at luxurious creations of the rich and famous. The journey ends on Lake Maggiore to see the most theatrical horticultural gem of Italy.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty visits influential gardens of the 19th Century, from royal retreats to the very first public parks.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty concludes his journey by looking at how the nations gardens have evolved over the last hundred years.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton is headed to meet up with Andrew Norbye on Lake Guntersville in Alabama. With not a lot of current being pulled, the deep schools werent set up to feed. So they went up shallow to fish grass until evening time when the ledge fish really started biting.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Rex meets up with Mr Crappie Wally Marshall in Texas. Wally takes Rex to one of his secret spots to put the hammer on the crappie. Not only did they catch crappie, but nice largemouth and some top tier coppernose bluegill.

programme.title: The Cast

With multiple species allowed including northern pike, the two teams are neck and neck after the first two periods. Due to bad weather on day 2, period 3 turned into a hour speed round where only keeper largemouth count.

programme.title: The Cast

Mike teaches the guys about the local waters including pogey boats and most importantly, world class red fish.

programme.title: The Cast

Even though fishing is tough the guys build strong friendships and lasting memories.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton stays close to home and heads to the Lake of The Ozarks joining Austin Culbertson for a frigid couple days of fishing. The cold weather doesnt hold back the fish, though, as they target brush piles with jerk baits and umbrella rigs.
